p: The DPPH test aimed to measure the capacity of the essential oil to scavenge the free radical 1,1-diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) by the donation of hydrogen atoms or electrons [ 8]. The effect of the oil on DPPH radical scavenging was compared to BHT (Butylated Hydroxytoluene), used as positive control, and the IC 50 values were determined. The scavenging effect of the essential oil and standard BHT on the DPPH radical expressed as IC 50 values was 0.451 mg/mL for P. microphylla vs. 0.067 mg/mL for BHT ( Table 2). Therefore, the oil did not show a high antioxidant activity compared to the BHT, as presented in Table 2.
